Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown with part of palmette in added white and added red; exterior, slip worn; painted decoration consisting of perhaps part of collar, neck and ears of a hound to right.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the hound, see British Museum 1888,0601.467.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0779) (phase 2)
